intro: Hippocratea pallida, commonly known as the pale hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Hippocratea pallida is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
